meanings.definition: Persistently pursued or pursued with determination.
meanings.sent1: The bulldogged detective never gave up on solving the case.
meanings.sent2: She showed a bulldogged attitude when facing challenges.
meanings.sent3: The bulldogged squirrel refused to share its nuts with anyone.
meanings.sent4: His bulldogged focus on his goals led him to success.
meanings.sent5: The bulldogged student studied late into the night for the exam.

meanings.sent1: Despite the obstacles, she remained bulldogged in her pursuit of happiness.
meanings.sent2: The bulldogged child refused to eat his vegetables.
meanings.sent3: The bulldogged cat refused to move from its favorite spot on the couch.
meanings.sent4: Her bulldogged determination impressed everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The bulldogged athlete never gave up during the race.

meanings.definition: To grip or hold onto something tightly.
meanings.sent1: He bulldogged the rope to secure the boat to the dock.
meanings.sent2: The toddler bulldogged onto his favorite toy and wouldn't let go.
meanings.sent3: The comedian bulldogged onto the microphone for dear life during his stand-up routine.
meanings.sent4: She bulldogged her backpack to her shoulders before heading out.
meanings.sent5: The climber bulldogged the rock face to reach the summit.
